name: allergenic
content:
Add to word list

causing or likely to cause allergic reactions (= physical problems caused by particular substances): Research is being done into hypoallergenic versions of foods that are commonly allergenic, like peanuts. In the skin test, tiny amounts of allergenic substances are placed on the patient's arm or back. Compare
anti-allergenic
hypoallergenic
non-allergenic
More examplesFewer examplesHe said that he did not know of any studies that showed that any one breed of horse is less allergenic than another. They claim that genetic engineering can actually make a food less allergenic.This species is a threat to human health due to its abundant allergenic pollen.When a baby is being weaned, cereals, usually rice, which is less allergenic than wheat, are often given first.
